org.usfirst.frc.team2077.video.sources

Class AbstractSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team2077.video.sources.AbstractSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VideoSource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GIFImageSource, GstreamerSource, ImageSource, MappedViewSource, MjpegSource

    public abstract class AbstractSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements VideoSource
    Base VideoSource implementation. Includes code to execute a startup command on a remote host as a part of the local startup sequence (to be split into a separate class eventually). The remote command is restarted if the source stops receiving frame updates after some interval. This restart logic is ill-tuned and may be causing more harm than good. It needs work.

    Configuration properties:

    <source>.projection
    Fully qualified name of a SourceProjection class. The projection will be instantiated by calling a constructor taking parameters (String name, VideoSource videoSource), where name is its configuration property prefix and videoSource is the calling VideoSource. The proper source projection, with proper configuration values, should implement the camera lens projection function, mapping cartesian source image coordinates to the corresponding spherical vector coordinates being projected. See FisheyeCalibration for more on how to do this.
    <source>.camera-NS-position
     
    <source>.camera-EW-position
     
    <source>.camera-height
    Camera lens location relative to the global system origin, in physical units. Used by projections that utilize absolute camera position as well as angle, such as Birdseye.
    <source>.remote
    Name or address of host on which to on which to execute an optional command associated with starting this source. If not supplied, no remote startup command will be executed.
    <source>.login
     
    <source>.password
    Login credentials for remote startup execution.
    <source>.command
    Remote startup command.

    Author:
    FRC Team 2077, R. A. Buchanan

      • processFrame

        protected void processFrame(RenderedView view,
                            java.nio.IntBuffer sourceFramePixels)
        Updates a view image with pixels from an incoming source frame.
        Parameters:
        view - View to be updated.
        sourceFramePixels - Pixel data for one full frame from this video source.

      • buildMap

        protected void buildMap(RenderedView view)
        Builds table of where pixel data from this source appears in any view that uses it. Each rendering using this source generates its own subtable, and these are merged into a single table of index pairs {viewPixelIndex0, sourcePixelIndex0, viewPixelIndex1, sourcePixelIndex1... viewPixelIndexN, sourcePixelIndexN} to be used to update pixels in the view image whenever a new frame arrives from the source.
        Parameters:
        view - View whose pixel source map is being updated.

      • activateViews

        Specified by:
        activateViews in interface VideoSource
        Parameters:
        views - Views to which this source should supply video frames.
